alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON, NORTHERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, SOUTHERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Morrow, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Loveland, Montgomery, Blanchester, Morrow, Sixteen Mile Stand, Highpoint, South Lebanon, Woodville, Maineville, Owensville, Goshen, Newtonsville, Fayetteville, Midland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, St. Martin, Murdock, State Route 123 at State Route 132 and Chasetown. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 19 and 22, and near mile marker 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
